Provided verbal notice of Adverse Level of Care Determination to the facility representative by phone. Notified they will receive a letter of explanation of right to Appeal, they may request a Peer-to-Peer by calling the phone number in the letter. 
Date/Time   01/15/20201015am
Facility Representative:   Shelby

Your doctor admitted you to the hospital on 01/07/20. The diagnosis was chest pain. We looked at the medical records sent to us. We reviewed the guideline for a hospital stay. You do not have to be in the hospital for this care. The reason is there is no lasting low blood pressure.  There was no heart attack. Your inpatient hospital stay is not covered. You did not need to be admitted to the hospital for this care.

Medical Director Name & Department: Olabisi Kuye, MD,   - UnitedHealthcare Clinical Services 
Criteria Used: MCG Care Criteria M-40 ISC ORG - Angina(23rd Edition) 
OAC 5160-1-01 medical necessity

Case Summary & Comments:
01/07/2020 
Primary diagnosis: Unstable angina 

41 YO F w/ chest pain and is at higher risk for secondary events due to previous history V fib arrest. Work showed no clinically significant findings. C/o squeezing chest pain for 2 days , left sided. Pain occurred at rest and with no significant radiation. Not associated with any sweating or diaphoresis. 

PMH: Asthma COPD DM Hyperlipidemia CAD STEMI   HTN
H/o coronary angiography that showed only 50 to 55% stenosis of the proximal LAD but IVUS confirmed 82% luminal reduction. Underwent primary PCI. 
H/o Ventricular fibrillation and cardiac arrest requiring emergent cardioversion 6 months ago and had 1 stent placed due to 80% occlusion of the LAD. 
Stress test in September 2019 that was unremarkable. She continues to smoke. 

VS:  97.1 71 18 97% room air 106/ 75 
Physical exam: 
Pertinent labs:  WBC 4.3 H&H 13 39 Glu 104 
Trop < 0.03 (negative x2)

CXR -The lungs are without acute focal process. No effusion or pneumothorax. 
EKG rate 66 

A/  suggestive of unstable angina. 
P/  cardiac catheterization with coronary angiography to assess their coronary anatomy and facilitate better treatment recommendations 

1/8/20
Cath was completed and showed no stenosis with widely patent stent. 
Discharged

There is no documentation of angina necessitating acute intervention (angiography with possible revascularization) as indicated by ALL of the following: Unstable angina is present as indicated by ischemic symptoms (e.g., chest pain, dyspnea) that are attributed to acutely active coronary plaque as indicated by 1 or more of the following: New-onset symptoms, significant change from baseline stable angina symptoms (i.e., symptoms that are worse in severity or frequency), symptoms at rest or with minimal exertion, crescendo worsening of symptoms (i.e., acutely changing) AND Ischemic symptoms warrant acute intervention (e.g., coronary angiography with intent to revascularize if appropriate) as indicated by 1 or more of the following: Accelerating tempo of ischemic symptoms in preceding 48 hours, prolonged (greater than 20 minutes) symptoms at rest, pulmonary edema, new or worsening mitral regurgitation murmur, third heart sound, persistent hemodynamic instability, age over 75 years, transient ST-segment deviation of 0.5 mm or more on ECG, recurrent or refractory ischemic symptoms (e.g., despite treatment), TIMI risk score of 2 or greater, history of percutaneous coronary intervention within last 6 months, history of CABG surgery, Left ventricular ejection fraction less than 40%, Chronic renal insufficiency, history of diabetes or intermediate or high-risk cardiac ischemia findings on noninvasive testing (e.g., echocardiogram, stress test.). There is no evidence of an acute myocardial infarction by EKG or positive cardiac biomarkers. 

Decision: Coverage for inpatient admission for acute inpatient level of care is not approved. Issue a denial letter.

Member discharged prior to review unable to impact discharge planning.



Current Level of Functioning: Independent

Facility DCP Name:  UR

Facility DCP Phone Number:  see tab 6

External DC Referrals: [HHC, DME, Health @ Scales, etc.]

Internal DC Referrals: N/A

 PCP's name and phone # and verification f/u visit with PCP or Specialist:


Member Address: 
See HSR under  member details


Member Home Phone: 
See HSR under  member details


Member Cell Phone: 

RST at Discharge:  14/107 

90050000  Prior Hospitalization : 9  Age : 0  Current Length of Stay (LOS) : 0  Diagnosis/co-morbidity : 5  Clinical Condition : 0  Complexity of Discharge Needs : 0  Mental Health/Behavioral Health : 0  Medications of Discharge : 0  Comments : H/o Member discharged prior to review unable to impact discharge planning Dx with Unstable angina   Total Score : 14  

Discharge Disposition: Home

No copy discharge summary  provided

Tasked to MD for:  Tasking to medical director for secondary review of 1 day LOS. 
 
Meets for Admission is indicated by 1Ischemic symptoms warrant acute intervention (eg, coronary angiography with intent to revascularize if appropriate) as indicated by 1TIMI risk score of 2 or greater(10)  TIMI Calculator
Thrombolysis in Myocardial Infarction (TIMI) Risk Score(1)
 Aspirin use in past 7 days? (+1)
Known CAD (stenosis 50% or more)? (+1)
3 or more risk factors for CAD? (+1) 
( Diabetes, Hypertension and known CAD/ MI)

Score: 3
Score of 3 equates to 13.2% risk at 14 days of: all-cause mortality, new or recurrent MI, or severe recurrent ischemia requiring urgent revascularization


MCG ORG/GRG or InterQual criteria reviewed (include clinical indications met if applicable):
 
Angina
ORG: M-40 (ISC) 

The date (s) of clinical you are reviewing (please specify observation and inpatient dates):
 
Admitted 01/07/2020 Discharged 01/08/2020


Primary diagnosis:  Unstable angina 
 
 
History of present illness:
 
 41 year old female presented with chest pain and is at higher risk for secondary events due to previous history V fib arrest.  Work showed no clinically significant findings.  C/o squeezing chest pain for 2 days , left sided.  Pain occurred at rest and with no significant radiation. 
Not associated with any sweating or diaphoresis. 
EKG was sinus and troponin was negative x2.

However based on her history plan will be to admit to the hospital for diagnostic cath in the morning. 

H/o Ventricular fibrillation and cardiac arrest requiring emergent cardioversion 6 months ago and had 1 stent placed due to 80% occlusion of the LAD.

Past medical history:
 
Asthma COPD Diabetes Hyperlipidemia  CAD  STEMI hypertension 
H/o coronary angiography that showed only 50 to 55% stenosis of the proximal LAD but IVUS confirmed 82% luminal reduction. Underwent primary PCI.


Stress test in September 2019 that was unremarkable. She continues to smoke.

ED/Observation treatment:



Vital signs (include repeat Day 1 VS if available):
 
 97.1 71 18 97% room air 106/ 75

Physical exam:
 

Pertinent labs:
 
 WBC 4.3  H&H 13 39    Glu 104 
Trop < 0.03 


Radiology/EKG:
 CXR -The lungs are without acute focal process. No effusion or pneumothorax.
 
EKG rate 66 


Treatment plan:


PLAN: Patient with history of V. fib arrest in the setting of ST segment elevation myocardial infarction back in June 2019.
Primary PCI to proximal LAD for an IVUS confirmed stenosis of 82%.
Current picture is suggestive of unstable angina.
Abnormal Stress Test:
For these reasons, I recommended that the patient consider undergoing a cardiac catheterization with coronary angiography to assess their coronary anatomy and facilitate better treatment recommendations

Response to treatment (on date of admission):
 
 
Day 2 or additional/further clinical info if applicable (Please include specific dates):

Cath was completed and showed no stenosis with widely patent stent.
Discharged  01/08/2020 home

Escalation to Medical Director for LOC Determination. Provided verbal Notice of a potential Adverse Determination to facility or attending physician/physician representative by phone. Informed the facility that if an Adverse Determination is made, the provider will be provided an opportunity to conduct a P2P.
Date/Time:   01/14/2020 1154am 
Facility Representative: UR
 Message left on confidential voicemail

Shelby Floyd 
513-486-9480 
513-458-7760 reviews Mercy Lorain  and Mercy Tiffin ( Shelby Floyd)

Due by:  12:00 noon 01/09/2020


***Please provide at least 2 days of clinical for review.***

**At discharge provide  copy of discharge summary

If observation please provide copy of observation order.
